revised_title: Astronomical Observations of the Transit of Venus at Prince of Wales's Fort
tldr: The authors, William Wales and Joseph Dymond, conducted astronomical observations of the transit of Venus at Prince of Wales's Fort on the North-West Coast of Hudson's Bay. They recorded data on the transit, including the time, temperature, and atmospheric conditions, and made adjustments to their equipment to ensure accurate measurements. The observations aimed to determine the Earth's distance from the Sun and improve understanding of celestial mechanics.
